data.title: followup to #522
data.body: Contrary to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buoyancy#Archimedes.27_principle, getting players to float similar to rigidshapes and wheeledvehicles when water density matches or exceeds it, we need to get the water density derived from https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/69838bdc8c9bc055b9b1ae76f42b0f28d2a33909/Engine/source/T3D/shapeBase.cpp#L1607 and divide that by player density *(and again, specifically player density. the rest work fine) rather than the other way around.

data.body: Work by @andr3wmac based on Konrad Kiss's Sahara which was [released](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/138296/) under the MIT license. Replaces #726.

data.title: castRay should take a RayInfo& not a RayInfo*
data.body: The `castRay` family assumes that it will not be passed a `NULL` pointer to a `RayInfo` object, so this parameter should be a reference, not a pointer.

data.title: Deferred Shading
data.body:
Prepass to deferred shading refactor.

Alterations:
Core: 
Gbuffer Overhaul.
Concurrent render target generation for lighting and diffuse information.
Auxiliary:
Refactored cubemap and dynamiccubemap blending to utilize the specular map rather than require 2 (or more) diffuse passes. (largely due to gbuffer alteration needs)
Gamma Correction now falls within the range of monitor gammas, and uses linear correction to better match texture-sheet to in-game colorization.

Additions:
Replaced non-functional environment map slot with Translucency Mapping.
Incorporated dynamic cubemap support for tsstatics.
Incorporated https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/710 for obvious reasons.
Added explicit brightness and contrast controls.

data.title: RigidShape is in the Platform doc group
data.body: [O.o](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/T3D/rigidShape.cpp#L95) ahoy.

data.title: ScatterSky Flare Rendering - Occlusion Is Broken
- Added check in tsMesh::createTangents to check size of incoming normal...
data.body:
Added a check to make sure the _norms and _verts are the same size. later on in this function it loops over the vertex size and indexes the _norms, this could cause problems if the size doesn't match.

Also Vector.size() returns a signed integer so added a check for negative numbers too.

data.title: Inconsistent shape file names
data.body: `Projectile` expects `projectileShapeName`. `TSStatic` expects `shapeName`. Everything else uses `shapeFile`. Let's make everything use `shapeFile` and add deprecation warnings to the others.

Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body: Thread statics were not compiling due to not being able to get a const reference to the memory instance. Fixed by adding a new function to get a const pointer. Required for thread static tests to pass in #728.

data.title: Water Object surface height queries
data.body:
The water object's are missing surface height queries for the 3d waves. I'm not sure what the best way to do this is. For starters, I copied the algorithm from the vertex shader into the WaterPlane's getSurfaceHeight().

I just thought I'd create this pull request to open a discussion.

data.title: Implemented physics collision for MeshRoad
data.body: According to [deepscratch's post](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/130181/1#comment-826897) in the forum. It seems like his fix had been half-implemented, adding `mPhysicsRep` to `MeshRoad`, but it was still unused. This adds the remainder of his code, as well as an extra line that deletes the existing `mPhysicsRep` before creating a new one.

data.title: Load new DLL first so existing projects don't see odd behavior

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body: As introduced in #698, the engine now compiles to `ProjectName DLL.dll` instead of `ProjectName.dll`. If you have an existing project and merge these changes in, then recompile, you'll end up with both files adjacent to your executable. The engine currently looks for `ProjectName.dll` first, and if it finds it, loads it. This change reverses that order, so the new-format DLL is loaded in preference to the old one - but you can still use a filename without the `DLL` suffix when deploying, if you prefer.

data.title: Fix splashscreen

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body: Includes Jeff's work in #735, but works on other platforms, and behaves more nicely with template scripts. Formerly, the splash screen was getting closed and the canvas shown _before_ the tools scripts were loaded, resulting in several seconds of pause. Now the canvas is shown after `onStart` has finished, so tools have already loaded.

data.body:
kills off the presence of a fake light when there are no others in a given scene. apparently this was causing other issues down the pipe.
special note, the lack of a skybox or scattersky will still reveal the canvasclearcolor. the presence of a skybox does still result in that rendering as normal.

data.title: GuiTreeView bug in buildVisibleTree
data.body:
There was a bug in buildVisibleTree, it should be setting the RebuildVisible flag, not clearing it.

The clip rectangle did not appear to be updating when expanding items or calling scrollVisible, which expands all the items to make a particular item visible. This would cause part of the tree to be cut off.

Setting the RebuildVisible flag made the problem go away.

data.title: GuiObjectView - Fixed rotation bug
data.body:
There was a bug with GuiObjectView causing the view to rotate around the wrong axis instead of the center of the object that was loaded.
A fix was posted on the GarageGames forums a while back, but never seems to have made its way in to the repo.

reference: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/126414/1#comment-825677

data.title: Particle system refactor
data.body:
As described [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22801).

I believe I've managed to port all the existing features to the new Particle System except for the "multiple particledatablocks per system" feature, which I'm still not sure of the purpose of.
It could possibly be created by having a "compositeParticleSystem" that creates 2 ParticleSystems and emits from both of them.

This has only been lightly tested and heavy testing before merging is recommended.

Things that especially need testing:
- Animated billboard textures.
- Integration into existing classes.

If this PR goes through, then I will be releasing some of my IPS documentation for the ParticleSystem.

data.title: Re-enable Mixed particle rendering

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
There seems to have been some copy-pasta and maintenance issues that have caused Mixed rendering to be unfunctional.
This commit fixes those issues and re-enables mixed rendering, as explained [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22804).

Currently renders the low-res particles at 1/4 the resolution. To increase or decrease this, look at line 77 in RenderParticleMgr.

Performance difference with 2 emitters,  each emitting 1000 particles per second: 

| Method | MSPF | Impact |
| --- | :-: | :-: |
| Highres | 27 | 8.5 |
| MixedRes | 20 | 1.5 |
| No emitters | 18.5 |  |

data.title: Internal class namespaces are unlinked when deleting objects
data.body:
1) Create an object (e.g. Prefab) "Foo"
2) Create another object (e.g. TSStatic) "Foo" using the same name using a different base class (so "Error: cannot change namespace parent linkage" print is called)
3) Delete the second object

When unlinking the namespace, the code will assume the top namespace is pointing to the "Foo" namespace when in fact it is pointing to "TSStatic" which will then be unlinked ( see https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/console/simObject.cpp#L1603 ). Any TSStatic objects from then on will no longer have any SceneObject or SimObject methods available to script.

Relying on the object name being an indicator that a namespace is unlinkable appears to be a pretty poor decision here.

data.title: WaterObject loose reflection.

data.title: New SSAO method
data.body:
As described [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/21060), this change will give both an improvement in the visual results of SSAO as well as a significant FPS improvement.

**However,** it should be noted that this PR doesn't remove the existing SSAO method, and the only way to change between them is to rename the original "SSAO.cs" to something Torque doesn't find like "SSAO.ncs".

This PR is mostly here for discussion and I will change it to a PR that replaces the current SSAO implementation if there is an interest. Personally I've had a lot more success with the new SSAO method.

data.title: Cleanup: remove component system
data.body: There's a half-done component system hanging out in [source/component](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/tree/development/Engine/source/component) which is currently unused. It should be removed from the repo, especially in light of Jeff's new component work.

data.title: Ribbon implementation

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
This PR adds an implementation of Tim Newell's ribbon code, with a "ParticleEmitterNode-like" RibbonNode.

Since receiveing the code from Tim, the following changes has been made:
- Option for fixed texCoords has been added to prevent "floating" textures.
- Tilescale has been added to scale texCoords.
- Now uses RIBBON_NUM_FIELDS instead of constant values for key value arrays.
- Option for skipping an amount of emitted segments such that you can optimize the ribbons when necessary by emitting e.g. 50% of the original amount of segments, at the cost of less "smoothness".
- Now only update buffers when new segments are added (Optimization).
- Option for preventing texture stretching, such that textures always look uniformly sized.
- A number of fixes, like being able to have more than 2 key-values.

[This video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tb-bZh8gvHQ) shows off most of the new "front-end" features.

data.title: TCPObject setting a class
Improving CMake build system for power users

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
While the CMake build systems default behavior emulates the functionality of the old project generator system it replaces it is sometimes necessary to override this behavior for certain custom setups. 

The project name can already be set when running cmake from the command line, e.g. `cmake -DTORQUE_APP_NAME`, however the location of the project directory and copying of template files can not be set. This pull request:
- Makes it possible to override the project directory location by setting `TORQUE_APP_DIR`.
- Makes it possible to skip template installation (copying) to project directory by setting `TORQUE_TEMPLATE` to `OFF`.
